title: Supreme Court Emergency Order in Trump v. Boyle
summary: Supreme Court 6-3 unsigned order allows Trump to fire three Democratic CPSC commissioners without cause, reversing district court reinstatement. Kagan dissent warns court 'all but overturned' 90-year Humphrey's Executor precedent protecting independent agencies. Kavanaugh suggests court may formally strike down precedent.
citations: U.S. Supreme Court — Trump v. Boyle (order, Jul 23, 2025) (PDF): https://www.supremecourt.gov/opinions/24pdf/25a11_2cp3.pdf
SCOTUSblog — Trump v. Boyle case page (Jul 23, 2025): https://www.scotusblog.com/cases/case-files/trump-v-boyle/

Reuters — U.S. Supreme Court lets Trump remove CPSC commissioners (Jul 23, 2025): https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/us-supreme-court-lets-trump-remove-consumer-product-safety-commissioners-2025-07-23/
notes: Fired commissioners were Mary Boyle, Richard L. Trumka Jr., and Alexander Hoehn-Saric. Court cited Trump v. Wilcox precedent allowing NLRB firings. Kagan dissent decried emergency docket use to 'destroy independence of independent agency.' Kavanaugh concurrence indicated 'fair prospect' court will overturn Humphrey's Executor.

sources.title: Supreme Court sides with Trump administration in battle over ability to remove agency commissioners
Supreme Court allows Trump to remove consumer product safety regulators
Supreme Court allows Trump to fire 3 Democrats on consumer safety panel for now
Justice Elena Kagan warns Supreme Court just 'all but overturned' 90-year precedent
